section.title: Configuring &THIS.PLATFORM; SNMP Adaptor
section.para: The SNMP Adaptor is configured with five files.

listitem.para: defines adaptor beans and their configuration.
defines managers which are notified (by trap or info requests) by this adaptor.
defines credentials used in communication with managers.
defines how JMX notification is converted into SNMP Trap of SNMP Info. It is used to generate MIB file.
defines attributes which can be managed with SNMP. It is used to generate MIB file.
mib files are generated based on attributes.xml and notifications.xml. In short it contains mapping between OID(Object Identifier) and its type defined in mentioned files.

section.title: Management Information Base(MIB)
section.para: SNMP identifies network devices by their OID. More detailed information about OID can be found here.
&THIS.PLATFORM; SNMP Adaptor configuration file follow OID scheme outlined below:

listitem.para: .1.3.6.1.4.1.2312.101 - OID indicating &THIS.PLATFORM;
.1.3.6.1.4.1.2312.101.1 - OID for server one(identifies specific server in network)
.1.3.6.1.4.1.2312.101.1.100 - OID root for SLEE management(maps SLEE JMX beans)
.1.3.6.1.4.1.2312.101.1.200 - OID root for &THIS.PLATFORM; specific management(maps &THIS.PLATFORM; specific JMX beans)
.1.3.6.1.4.1.2312.101.1.300 - OID root for application specific management(SLEE JMX beans which expose management for services)

section.title: Adaptor Service
section.para: SNMP Adaptor is a simple JBoss service. The jboss-services.xml manages this service. It defines following beans:

listitem.para: Simple manager bean. It consumes SNMP commands. It has following, configurable, attributes:
BindAddress - address to which this agent will bind.
Port - port to which this agent will bind.
Bean which manages system information according to RFC 1213 iso.org.dod.internet.mgmt.mib-2.system.*
Is the heart of adaptor. Based on passed configuration, it allocates worker resources and manages notification subscription. It is configured by following mbean attributes:

RequestHandlerClassName - name of class implementing org.jboss.jmx.adaptor.snmp.agent.RequestHandler interface. This class is responsible for mapping incoming requests to specific MBean attributes accessors.
RequestHandlerResName - URI of XML configuration file. It is used to build association between MBean attributes and SNMP managed attributes. In default deploymen it is called attributes.xml.
TrapFactoryClassName - name of class implementing org.jboss.jmx.adaptor.snmp.agent.TrapFactory interface. This class is responsible for conversion of JMX notification payload into SNMP trap or info.

NotificationMapResName - URI of XML configuration file. It is used to build association between JMX Notification attributes and SNMP trap or info message. In default deploymen it is called notifications.xml.
ManagersResName - URI of XML configuration file. It is used to build base of remote managers this agent should notify. In default deploymen it is called managers.xml.
UsersResName - URI of XML configuration file. It is used to build base of users and their credentials. In default deploymen it is called users.xml.
HeartBeatPeriod - integer value. It indicates value (in seconds!) between agent sending SNMP heart beat to managers.
BindAddress - address to which this agent will bind.
Port - port to which this agent will bind.
DynamicSubscriptions - boolean value which controls agent ability to handle dynamic subscription to JMX Notifications. Depending on value:

upon start, adapter will process subscription list and try to subscribe to each listed MBean. It will also process MBeanServer notification of newly deployed MBeans. If new MBean matches one from list, adapter will subscribe to notifiacations this MBean emits.
adapter will process subscription list ONLY on start, it will ignore MBeanServer notification of newly deployed MBeans.

SubscriptionList - contains XML description of subscriptions. This attribute instructs adapter to which MBeans and types of notifications it should subscribe to. In short, this attribute element, contains single subscription-list child element. The subscription-list supports single type of children: mbean. The mbean element, has single attribute called name. It contains JMX expression which is used to match actual mbean name. Example entry may look as follows:
listitem.programlisting:
<subscription-list> <!-- Monitor events from SNMP adaptor itself --> <mbean name="jboss.jmx:name=SnmpAgent,service=snmp,type=adaptor"> <notification type="jboss.snmp.agent.coldstart"/> </mbean> <!-- Monitor timer for heartbeat events --> <mbean name="jboss.jmx:name=SnmpAgent,service=timer,type=heartbeat"> <notification type="jboss.snmp.agent.heartbeat"/> </mbean>
<!-- NOTE: notification.type is used for NotificationFilter, matched as notification.getType().startsWith(${type}) --> <!-- SLEE mgmt:alarms --> <mbean name="javax.slee.management:name=Alarm"> <notification type="javax.slee.management.alarm"/> </mbean> <!-- SLEE mgmt:state change --> <mbean name="javax.slee.management:name=SleeManagement"> <notification type="javax.slee.management.sleestatechange"/> </mbean> </subscription-list>

note.para: For detailed description of this attribute please reffer to this file.

section.title: Managers
section.para: This file(managers.xml) controls managers instances to which adaptor(agent) connects to. Root element of this file is manager-list. It contains list of manager XML nodes. Each defines single manager. manager entry has following children:

listitem.para: its value indicates manager's address (IP address or host name).
its value defines manager's listening port.
its value defines local address to which adaptor will bind. This entry is optional.
its value indicates local port to which adaptor will bind. This entry is optional.
its value indicates SNMP version to be used. Allowed values are 1,2 and 3
for versions 1 and 2 its value is used as community string (public or private)

section.para: Example content may look like:
section.programlisting: <manager-list> <!-- A default test manager to forward traps. It is controlled by the "jboss.jmx:name=SnmpAgent,service=trapd,type=logger" MBean that simply outputs received traps as log4j DEBUG messages --> <!-- v1 manager --> <manager> <address>localhost</address> <port>162</port> <local-address></local-address> <local-port></local-port> <version>1</version> <community-string>public</community-string> </manager> <!-- v2c manager --> <manager> <address>localhost</address> <port>162</port> <local-address></local-address> <local-port></local-port> <version>2</version> <community-string>public</community-string> </manager> <!-- v3 manager --> <manager> <address>localhost</address> <port>162</port> <local-address></local-address> <local-port></local-port> <version>3</version> </manager> </manager-list>

section.title: Users
section.para: This file(users.xml) defines users credentials for managers which use V3 of SNMP. Root element of this file is user-list. It contains list of user XML nodes. Each defines single user. user entry has following children:

listitem.para: its value indicates security name of the user (typically the user name).
its value defines the authentication protocol to be associated with this user (MD5 or SHA). If not set, this user only supports unauthenticated messages.

its value defines password. If present, the authentication Protocol must also be present. RFC3414 ยง11.2 requires passphrases to have a minimum length of 8 bytes. If the length is less than 8 bytes an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
its value indicates the privacy protcol ID to be associated with this user (DES, 3DES, AES128, AES192, AES256). If not set, this user only supports unencrypted messages.

if present, the privacyProtocol must also be set. RFC3414 ยง11.2 requires passphrases to have a minimum length of 8 bytes. If the length is less than 8 bytes an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.

section.title: Attributes
section.para: This file(attributes.xml) controls the mapping of JMX mbean attributes to SNMP OID. Root element of this file is attribute-mappings, it supports single type of child elements: mbean. Each child defines JMX mbean which is mapped. The mbean element supports following attributes:

listitem.para: name - JMX name of bean, ie. javax.slee.management:name=SleeManagement
oid-prefix - optional OID. If present, it is prepended to attribute OID

section.para: The mbean element, supports single type of child element: attribute. Which in turn supports following attributes:

listitem.para: name - matches bean attribute name( without get/set prefix)
oid - OID suffix. Identifies this attribute in SNMP world

table - boolean attribute indicating if mbean attribute is of array/collection type. This supports only java basic types, if non basic type is accessed, the .toString() method is called to convert. Note that if attribute is of table type, oid must be suffixed with '.1'
mode - indicates access type to mbean attribute, default value is 'ro'(read-only), it is possible to specify 'rw'(read-write).
max-access - indicates access rights to mbean attribute from managers, default value is 'read-only', it is possible to specify 'read-write' or 'no-access'.

snmp-type - optional attribute, used by mib generator to give a hint on data type. Default value is 'OCTET STRING (SIZE(0..255))'. Following values are permited: OCTET STRING, BIT STRING, IpAddress, NsapAddress, Counter32, Gauge32, TimeTicks, Counter64, UInteger32. For full list refer to rfc1442.

section.para: Example content is listed below:
section.programlisting:
<attribute-mappings> <mbean name="javax.slee.management:name=SleeManagement" oid-prefix=".1.3.6.1.4.1.2312.101.1.100.1" definition-name="sleeManagement"> <attribute name="State" oid=".1" mode="r" snmp-type="OCTET STRING"/>/> <attribute name="SleeName" oid=".2" mode="r" snmp-type="OCTET STRING"/>/> <attribute name="SleeVendor" oid=".3" mode="r" snmp-type="OCTET STRING"/>/> <attribute name="SleeVersion" oid=".4" mode="r" snmp-type="OCTET STRING"/>/> <attribute name="Subsystems" oid=".5.1" mode="r" table="true"/> </mbean>
<mbean name="javax.slee.management:name=Alarm" oid-prefix=".1.3.6.1.4.1.2312.101.1.100.2" definition-name="alarmManagement"> <attribute name="Alarms" oid=".1" mode="r" table="true"/> </mbean> </attribute-mappings>

section.title: Notification
section.para: This file(notifications.xml) controls how JMX notifications are converted into SNMP trap or info. Root element of this file is notification-map-list. It supports single type fo child elements: mapping. Each mapping element, declares how notification should be converted to SNMP representation. The mapping supports following attributes:

listitem.para: notification-type - declares type of notification. It contains regular expression which is used to match JMXNotification.getType(). For instance to match all alarm notifications, value could be 'javax.slee.management.alarm.*'
enterprise - the OID value which MUST match OID of bean emiting this notification. This bean MUST be defined in attributes.xml.
generic - integer value. It identifies generic type of SNMP trap.
specific - integer value. It identifies specific type of SNMP trap.
inform - boolean value, if set to 'true', adaptor will send info instead of trap.
security-name - string matching user name, defined in users.xml. It is used only V3 of protocol.

section.para: The mapping supports single type of child element: var-bind-list. The var-bind-list defines notification variable binding. It supports single attribute: wrapper-class. It declares notification handlers class. By default, it should be set to org.jboss.jmx.adaptor.snmp.agent.NotificationWrapperSupport. The var-bind-list supports single type of child elements: var-bind. The var-bind declares specific variable binding. Binding data is declared in var-bind attributes. It supports following attributes:

listitem.para: tag - value which is used by trap generator to access value of this variable. Tag starts with one of following prefixes:
resevered for bindings of mbean attributes. Rest of tag must match mbean attribute name defined in attributes.xml. For instance 'a:startTime' MUST match attribute with name 'startTime'.
reserved for notification attributes(getX). For example 'n:oldState'. If this prefix is used, the 'oid' will create new definition in MIB.
reserved for user data. The 'u:key' will be looked up in notification user defined data. If this prefix is used, the 'oid' will create new definition in MIB.
oid - identifier of this variable. In case tag starts with 'a:' it has to match bean attribute OID(name must also match bean attribute name).
type - declares type of this variable, it has exactly the same meaning as 'snmp-type'.

section.para: By default, adaptor converts following data:

listitem.para: javax.management.Notification.getMessage()
javax.management.Notification.getSequenceNumber()
javax.management.Notification.getTimestamp()
javax.management.Notification.getType()
javax.management.Notification.toString()
javax.management.Notification.getClass().getName()
snmp agent/adaptor start time
snmp agent/adaptor up time
snmp agent/adaptor trap count

note.para: Above prefix and tag pairs are RESERVED!

section.para: Example file entry looks as follows:
section.programlisting:
<notification-map-list>
<mapping name="sleeManagementNotifications" notification-type="javax.slee.management.sleestatechange" generic="6" specific="10" enterprise=".1.3.6.1.4.1.2312.101.1.100.1" definition-name="sleeManagementNotifications" security-name="TEST"> <var-bind-list wrapper-class="org.mobicents.slee.tools.snmp.SleeStateNotificationWrapperSupport"> <var-bind tag="n:oldState" oid="1.3.6.1.4.1.2312.101.1.100.1.101" type="OCTET STRING"/> <var-bind tag="n:newState" oid="1.3.6.1.4.1.2312.101.1.100.1.102" type="OCTET STRING"/> </var-bind-list> </mapping>
<mapping name="alarmFacilityNotifications" notification-type="javax.slee.management.alarm.*" generic="6" specific="11" enterprise=".1.3.6.1.4.1.2312.101.1.100.2" definition-name="alarmFacilityNotifications" security-name="TEST"> <var-bind-list wrapper-class="org.mobicents.slee.tools.snmp.AlarmNotificationWrapperSupport"> <var-bind tag="n:source" oid="1.3.6.1.4.1.2312.101.1.100.2.101" type="OCTET STRING"/> <var-bind tag="n:level" oid="1.3.6.1.4.1.2312.101.1.100.2.102" type="OCTET STRING"/> <var-bind tag="n:instanceId" oid="1.3.6.1.4.1.2312.101.1.100.2.103" type="OCTET STRING"/> <var-bind tag="n:id" oid="1.3.6.1.4.1.2312.101.1.100.2.104" type="OCTET STRING"/> <var-bind tag="n:type" oid="1.3.6.1.4.1.2312.101.1.100.105" type="OCTET STRING"/> </var-bind-list> </mapping>
</notification-map-list>

section.title: Introduction
section.para: This section provides guide to management of tabular values.
Tabular types include:

listitem.para: arrays
java.util.List
java.util.Map

section.para: Tabular attributes may be of limited type. The types supported are:

listitem.para: integer
long
boolean
string

section.para: Tabular attribute values(scalar) can be accessed in two ways, by index of scalar value or by key. The difference will be shown showrtly.
To put context to example commands, consider bean which has following definition:
section.programlisting: <?xml version="1.0"?> <attribute-mappings> <mbean name="test.com:service=SnmpTest" oid-prefix=".1.3.6.1.4.1.2312.100.10.11"> <attribute name="Message" oid=".1" mode="rw"/> <attribute name="Count" oid=".2"/> <attribute name="MessageHistory" oid=".3.1" table="true" mode="rw"/> <attribute name="MessageHistoryAsArray" oid=".4.1" table="true" mode="rw"/> <attribute name="CountHistory" oid=".5.1" table="true" mode="rw"/> <attribute name="MessageCountHistory" oid=".6.1" table="true" mode="rw"/> </mbean> </attribute-mappings>

section.para: Notice that all attributes that will be exposed as table have the table attribute set to"true". Also as compared to scalar objects, the OID for a tabular object is a bit different. Indeed in SNMP both the Tabular Object itself and its Row Entry (describing the columns of the tabular object) have a distinct OID. So as an example MessageHistory attribute, will have an OID for the table itself, .1.3.6.1.4.1.2312.100.10.11.3 and for its row entry describing the columns .1.3.6.1.4.1.2312.100.10.11.3.1, both being non writable whereas the table contents itself will be writable since mode is set to "rw".
